data.title: Intellisense: change more details icon
data.body:
> @joaomoreno cool stuff, but is the info icon the right UI affordance for this? I feel like you could just have blue text that says "More". My two cents.

from @csinco

data.title: TypeScript syntax highlighting error when inline comment appears after return type declaration
Allow Code to be launched straight from Git Bash on Windows
data.body:
Fixes #1704. Follows the same logic in [the batch file](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/resources/win32/bin/code.cmd) to create a wrapper script for the executable and run it.

I've tested this locally on my machine, and it seems to be working well.

data.title: Index file in Git repository constantly updating

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi,

Ever since installing VS Code I seem to have a problem with Git/Dropbox.

Whenever I have a folder open in VS Code which is a git repository it seems to constantly update the index file and the FETCH_HEAD file. I don't mean every time I save a file, I mean every few seconds.

This causes a problem with Dropbox because I'm using it to sync files between my home and work computers. The notifications in the bottom right of my screen keep coming thick and fast and it's driving me crazy. Not to mention that Dropbox is constantly uploading files because it thinks they've changed.

Anyone else having this problem?

Version of VS Code: 0.10.6

data.title: scripts\npm install fails on Windows 10

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I'm trying to install the source code, but I hit a number of errors at the "scripts\npm install" phase, starting with the below.

npm ERR! Windows_NT 10.0.10586
npm ERR! argv "C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe" "C:\Users\jongg\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\npm\bin\npm-cli.js" "run" "compile"
npm ERR! node v4.2.6
npm ERR! npm  v3.6.0
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! vscode-json-server@0.0.1 compile: `tsc -p .`
npm ERR! Exit status 2
npm ERR!
npm ERR! Failed at the vscode-json-server@0.0.1 compile script 'tsc -p .'.
npm ERR! Make sure you have the latest version of node.js and npm installed.
npm ERR! If you do, this is most likely a problem with the vscode-json-server package,
npm ERR! not with npm itself.
npm ERR! Tell the author that this fails on your system:
npm ERR!     tsc -p .
npm ERR! You can get information on how to open an issue for this project with:
npm ERR!     npm bugs vscode-json-server
npm ERR! Or if that isn't available, you can get their info via:
npm ERR!     npm owner ls vscode-json-server
npm ERR! There is likely additional logging output above.

data.title: Out of workspace files: Changes from git operations not reflected

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: As above. I've been testing it out by switching branches in git using terminal and the file does not update. Sublime & Atom do it immediately, but with Code you have to switch out and back into the file in order for it to update.

data.title: Auto Format setting(s)
data.body:
Could you please add a setting for where the brace gets placed when autoformat runs.

When the auto format runs it moves the brace to a new line. This is very annoying to me.

data.title: [json] Auto-install imported/required npm packages

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
A great feature of VS Code is that it's aware of npm package names and their latest versions — it pulls them down to provide auto-complete in the `package.json` file.

This feature can be extended to provide a feature that a recent cool [webpack plugin](https://github.com/ericclemmons/npm-install-webpack-plugin) has been enabling — to automatically update the `package.json` with a required/imported npm module (as you type it), and also `npm install` it in the background. I think VS Code has enough smarts to be able to do this natively and even provide helpful feedback such as when the package wasn't found. This will take its Intellisense to another high level.

data.title: Cant tab back to the find input field from find/replace
data.body:
When doing a find and replace (<kbd>Ctrl+H</kbd>), when in the **find** input field I can press <kbd>Tab</kbd> and it goes to the **replace** input field but then if I press <kbd>Shift+Tab</kbd> I can't get back to the **find** input field.

The two field should <kbd>Tab</kbd>/<kbd>Shift+Tab</kbd> between each other.

data.title: Display number of search results in popup
data.body:
When In a document and you do <kbd>Ctrl+F</kbd> it would really be nice if that same popup showed how many results were found in the search.

For example:

> 1 of 10 results

Then when you go to the next match it says

> 2 of 10 results

and so on, This could be placed directly under the input field.

data.title: fix replacing end of line with newline
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2586

data.body:
Select end of line, hit enter (or copy+paste):

Check console:

data.title: Any reason why Ctrl + Shift + 0 keybinding is invalid?
data.body:
I'm trying to use `Ctrl + Shift + 0` as a keybinding, but it simply doesn't work. Strangely, if I try to use the new _Define Keybind_ interface, the _0_ key is ignored, remaining the previously pressed key.

Just out of curiosity, using `1..9` works. Also works (including `0`) if I use `Alt` instead of `Shift`.

Thanks in advance

data.title: Wrong caret position when typing with particular language
data.body:
The caret position always at the starts of the line when the line contains particular language script (for this example, Thai).

Video: https://youtu.be/NYXpi6SegTE
The bottom of the video indicate which key I press while I am typing.

As you can see in the video... The caret stays on the front of the line while typing at the end of the line.

However, when add some text at the end of the line and type at the start of the line, the caret is moving along properly. This also happen when move the caret to the end of the line contains that particular language script.

Info:
- OS X El Capitan v10.11.3 on MacBook Air (13-inch, Mid 2011)
- Visual Studio Code v0.10.6 (a80232bbcfe8a5cdad1ebc98638673d9dcb02458)

PS. In case you want the sentences above for testing on your own copy. Here...

```
แล้วสอนว่าอย่าไว้ใจมนุษย์
มันแสนสุดลึกล้ำเหลือกำหนด
ถึงเถาวัลย์พันเกี่ยวที่เลี้ยวลด
ก็ไม่คดเหมือนหนึ่งในน้ำใจคน

แม้นใครรักรักมั่งชังชังตอบ
ให้รอบคอบคิดอ่านนะหลานหนา
รู้สิ่งไรไม่สู้รู้วิชา
รู้รักษาตัวรอดเป็นยอดดี
```

data.title: Tooltips and intellisense stop altogether after watching build command
data.body:
I have the current task (that was working properly previously):

``` json
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "grunt",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": [
        "--no-color"
    ],
    "tasks": [
        {
            "isWatching": true,
            "isBuildCommand": true,
            "taskName": "watch",
            "problemMatcher": [
                {
                    "watchedTaskBeginsRegExp": "^Running(.*)\\(browserify\\)\\stask$",
                    "watchedTaskEndsRegExp": "^Completed\\sin\\s\\d+",
                    "owner": "typescript",
                    "fileLocation": ["relative", "${cwd}"],
                    "pattern": {
                        "regexp": "TypeScript\\serror:\\s([^\\s].*)\\((\\d+|\\d+,\\d+|\\d+,\\d+,\\d+,\\d+)\\):\\s+(Error|Warning|Info)\\s+(TS\\d+)\\s*:\\s*([\\s\\S]*)",
                        "file": 1,
                        "location": 2,
                        "severity": 3,
                        "code": 4,
                        "message": 5
                    }
                },
                {
                    "watchedTaskBeginsRegExp": "^Compiling...$",
                    "watchedTaskEndsRegExp": "^Completed\\sin\\s\\d+",
                    "owner": "typescript",
                    "fileLocation": ["absolute"],
                    "pattern": {
                        "regexp": "^([\\s\\S]*)\\((\\d+|\\d+,\\d+|\\d+,\\d+,\\d+,\\d+)\\):\\s+(error|warning|info)\\s+(TS\\d+)\\s*:\\s*([\\s\\S]*)$",
                        "file": 1,
                        "location": 2,
                        "severity": 3,
                        "code": 4,
                        "message": 5
                    }
                },
                {
                    "watchedTaskBeginsRegExp": "^Running([^\\(]+)\\(sass\\) task$",
                    "watchedTaskEndsRegExp": "^Completed in",
                    "fileLocation": ["relative", "${cwd}"],
                    "owner": "sass",
                    "pattern": {
                        "regexp": ">> ([^\\n\\r]+)[\\r\\n]>>\\s+Line\\s+(\\d+)\\s+Column\\s+(\\d+)\\s+([^\\n\\r]+)",
                        "message":1,
                        "file": 4,
                        "location": 2,
                        "column": 3
                    }
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
}
```

it's for grunt watch task that comprises of scss and typescript files through browserify and server srcs. 

After starting the task, and modifying any file, the task output shows:

```
Running "watch" task
Waiting...
>> File "src\client\sections\resultados.ts" changed.
Running "browserify:client" (browserify) task
>> Bundle public/js/app.js created.
Done, without errors.
Completed in 12.214s at Sun Jan 31 2016 11:28:41 GMT-0200 (E. South America Daylight Time) - Waiting...
```

although it finished properly, the intellisense stopped completely. hovering on anything yields nothing, nor goto declaration F12. there's nothing in DevTools console. the only way is to close and reopen the editor. using windows 10 64 bits and vscode 0.10.6, with node 5.5.0

![clipboard01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/461084/12702408/685c5fe0-c80f-11e5-807e-0884697a4297.png)

data.title: All instances of VSC are not restored.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I open multiple windows of VSC. When I restart / after a system crash the windows are not restored. I see an old session (particularly the one at the start of previous boot) .

Open VSC - State 1
Open more windows - State 2.
Restart / Crash and open.

Expected : State 2
Actual : State 1.

data.title: Do not bind Command+P on Mac

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Command + P in OS X is a system reserved key combination for Print which has been universally applied in MacOS and OS X applications since day one.

Please make sure you observe basic Apple UI guidelines for your Microsoft applications.

Thanks!

data.title: Add option to turn off anti-aliasing for editor font.
data.body:
Thanks for the great product!

Sublime Text allows you to turn off anti-aliasing, which looks great for some fonts:

``` javascript
{
    "font_face": "MS Gothic",
    "font_options":
    [
        "no_antialias"
    ],
    "font_size": 18,
}
```

I've looked around, but there doesn't seem to be an easy way to do this. Is there a way for me to do this in VSCode?

data.title: VSCode will not stop on breakpoints when first node prcess forks a second
Running code from command line does not open new instance nor open the folder specified in OSX

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:
It always open in the same window.

Also, when there is an instance of vscode running, runs `code .` on terminal brings up that instance instead of opening new window with the current folder nor open the current folder on the existing instance.

data.title: source maps with non-empty 'sourceroot' entries don't resolve to the correct source path
data.body:
Source maps of the form:

``` json
"sourceroot": ".../../src",
"sources": [ "node/nodeDebug.ts" ]
```

do not resolve to the correct source.
